column2: One of the Three Swords of Archendale, answerable to the Dales Council, and a hidden identity
One of the Three Swords of Archendale, answerable to the Dales Council, and a hidden identity
One of the Three Swords of Archendale, answerable to the Dales Council, and a hidden identity
Commander of archery and archer training.
A council of wizards in the kingdom of Cormyr, serving under the High Wizard.
Overseer of the Great Hall, Throne Room and Council Chamber.
Master of horse breeding and training for the cavalry.
Honorary title created by Byron Kendrick after the Calishite, Daryth, robbed his son, Tristan Kendrick, and Tristan begged his father to spare the robber’s life
Commander of foot soldier and unspecialized soldier training.
Overseer of physical structures and defences of the Royal Palace of Faerntarn.
In charge of the quarters of royalty and their heirs.
Director of staff of the royal household and master of ceremonies at royal feasts.
Groundskeeper for the Garden of Rhinda, the royal gardens at the Palace of Faerntarn.
Responsible for maintaining the Royal Palace of Faerntarn.
Overseer of the royal wine cellar and vineyards.
Sage to the lordship of Deepingdale, most learned and a title of great prestige in Deepingdale.
Appointed to the highest sage in Cormyr, the owner of this title is versed in the lessons of history and has an analytical mind.

Even the mightiest of Magic-Users feel the bite of time. The loss of loved ones, the very land changing, and of course, for the mortal races, death itself. Some Wizards, who do not desire Lichdom, begin a family. Clerics, often take on a protege priest. And of course Druids teach their young the arts. Regardless, a Magical Apprentice is one who is dedicated to carrying on their masters profession, if not surpass them.

As your Thieves guild expands, it quickly becomes a beast unmanagable even for one skilled as yourself. As such, appointing promising rogues and masterminds to lead the different branches is but the natural choice. Just beware they are overly ambitious...

The enforcer of enforcers, this Blackguard warrior has proven themselves in foreign lands, slaying enemies, and most of all, taking coin for you. By recognizing their prowess in court, who knows what events may transpire?
Appointed by the ruler, this dignitary is responsible for overseeing arcane magic in the court and the wider realm.

The Chief Qadi is the supreme judge and authority of the Enlightened Law in the realm. The most prestigious of all Qisma'ite honorary titles, it is only open to characters with a proper religious education.
column3: Le cadi est le juge suprême et fait figure de représentant de la loi illuminée au sein du pays. Plus prestigieux des titres honorifiques qisma'ites, cette fonction n'est accessible qu'aux personnes bénéficiant d'une éducation religieuse bien spécifique.
column4: Der Ober-Kadi ist der oberste Richter und die Autorität des Aufgeklärten Gesetzes im Reich. Der renommierteste aller qismaitischen Ehrentitel steht nur Charakteren offen, die einen angemessenen Religionsunterricht genossen haben.
column6: El Cadí Jefe es el juez supremo y autoridad de la ley illuminada en el dominio. Es el más prestigioso de los títulos honorarios qisma'ites, solo disponible a personajes con la debida educación religiosa.

column2: Only a Blackguard of great §Ystrength§! and §Ycunning§! could hold such a title.
Zulkirs are the leaders of the Thayan magocratic organizations dedicated each to a single school of arcane magic.
